results.title: Last resort
results.creator_credit: Robert Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: An insight into the role and function of the Victorian Ombudsman through the dramatization of actual cases investigated by the Office. Includes an interview with the Ombudsman.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Bob Scarfe, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: An education officer from the Museum of Victoria looks at a number of “labour saving appliances” used in the home over the last one hundred and fifty years and looks at the development of laundry and kitchen appliances.

results.title: Women working in the media
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Pat Walter, a video camera operator, Julie Copeland, a radio broadcaster and producer, and Lina Caneva, a TV and radio journalist, discuss their experiences as women working in the male-dominated TV and radio industry.

results.title: Science needs girls too
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program featuring Leonie Gianetto, Ursula Groves and Ann Osman from the McClintock Collective and students from Swinburne Community School and Swinburne Technical School who examine ways in which girls can be encouraged to take a more active part in the sciences.

results.title: Sexual harassment in schools
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program looks at some examples of sexual harassment in a school setting. Focuses on the consequences of harassing behaviour and avenues available to people who wish to take action to prevent it continuing. Ways of dealing with such incidences are suggested and legal rights under the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 are explained.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Bicycles down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An introduction to the history of the bicycle, looking at some of the technical and social changes in the past one hundred and twenty years. Bill Sidebottom and Doug McCann from Museum of Victoria present a collection of vintage and veteran bicycles to tell the story.

results.title: Waltzing Matilda: touring Australia
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion that intermingles aspects of Australian history and culture with holiday promotion. Narrated by Charles Tingwell with original music by Bruce Smeaton. The song “Walzing Matilda” played by the Bushwackers Band is used as a theme.

results.title: Meeting of minds: the mentor program
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program explores four mentor-student relationships. Each relationship is unique and serves to demonstrate the versatility of the mentor concept. The students are shown in their home and school environment. Administrative processes involved in the mentor program are also illustrated.

results.title: Conflict
results.creator_credit: Halina Sztynda, Melanie Guiney and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Presents the views of the Forest Commission, loggers and conservationists in regard to logging practices in East Gippsland. Allows the viewer to draw conclusions about the attitudes and prejudices of the conservationists and the loggers and saw millers.
